I was using OneDrive, but I think I found the problem. In [cmd/copy](https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/master/cmd/copy/copy.go#L75), rclone runs a sync if src is a directory and runs a CopyFile operation if it is a single file. Your commands are doing this on directories so `--backup-dir` works. Also, if `rclone sync` is used instead of `rclone copy` or `rclone move`, sync is always used so `--backup-dir` works even for a single file.

Gotcha :-)

So just after this in `moveOrCopyFile`

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/9aac2d6965222c6ae8483695e5835ec3737eed8a/fs/operations/operations.go#L1469-L1475

We need to implement this bit of logic which does the moving to the backup dir.

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/9aac2d6965222c6ae8483695e5835ec3737eed8a/fs/sync/sync.go#L227-L241

That opens a whole can of worms about where the backupDir comes from...

I'll work on that!

```
github.com/ncw/rclone/fs/operations.moveOrCopyFile(0x177e8c0, 0xc000187040, 0x0, 0x0, 0x7ffd06b28e64, 0x5, 0x7ffd06b28e64, 0x5, 0xc0001de001, 0x0, ...)

github.com/ncw/rclone/cmd/copy.glob..func1.1(0xc0005c4be0, 0x48)
        rclone/cmd/copy/copy.go:79 +0xbe
```

with the command `rclone -vv copy a.txt testdir --backup-dir backupdir`, which seems to be caused by this incorrect handling of error:

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/b19f6572d7199b17aeeb173aa87dab09be544c36/fs/cache/cache.go#L30-L35

`NewFs` may return a non-`nil` `fs` with the error `fs.ErrorIsFile`.

> `NewFs` may return a non-`nil` `fs` with the error `fs.ErrorIsFile`.

Ah, well spotted!

Try this!

https://beta.rclone.org/branch/v1.47.0-078-gc94b7f62-fix-3219-beta/ (uploaded in 15-30 mins)
I found no problems with the new version so far; we should be good to go. :)
Thanks for testing - I merged that now.

While trying to implement --suffix without --backup-dir i ran into this bug.

```
rclone v1.48.0
- os/arch: linux/amd64
- go version: go1.12.5
```

right now you check for the existence of --backup-dir in move & copy, however in sync there are a few sanity checks in newSyncCopyMove() that are not done here, for example not allowing the backup directory to be the same as the src or dst

https://github.com/ncw/rclone/blob/4549305fec833bf50516d287002cdba6548695c9/fs/sync/sync.go#L134-L142

so right now a command like:
```
rclone copy local/one.txt dest --backup-dir=local
```
will overwrite the src or error.


Unless you want to duplicate the checks and all --backup-dir and --suffix code, it might better to make a separate function somewhere (in config?) that gets passed the src, dst, backupdir, and suffix, that returns the final backup directory and suffix or an error.
this can then be called by any of the primitives if either backupdir or suffix flags are used.

this will also make implementing #2801 simpler.

if you think that is a good idea i and can point me where to put it i will start on it.
thanks
